articles.title: About this Workshop
articles.description:
The purpose of this workshop is to introduce the [DemocratizingData.ai](https://democratizingdata.ai/tools/dashboards/) platform and the uses of its dashboard to research-oriented agricultural economists. The DemocratizingData.ai platform has been developed to track data usage statistics for USDA data assets. The goal of the workshop is to gather feedback from invited participants about the current functionality of the USDA dashboard and potential future improvements. The format of the workshop is guided focus groups and interactive discussions designed for attendees to contribute to shaping the ongoing developments of the tool.

The workshop is led by agricultural economists Drs. [Allie Bauman](https://www.linkedin.com/in/allie-bauman-21a7b299/), [Alessandro Bonanno](https://agsci.colostate.edu/old-dare/people/faculty/dr-alessandro-bonanno/), [Rebecca Cleary](https://agsci.colostate.edu/old-dare/people/faculty/dr-rebecca-cleary/), and [Lauren Chenarides](https://www.linkedin.com/in/laurenchenarides/) from Colorado State University. The workshop facilitator is Dr. [Mayla Boguslav](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mayla-boguslav-phd-30402239/).

The workshop is supported by funding from the USDA Economic Research Service.

articles.title: Exploring the Future of Data Search: A Thought Experiment
articles.contents:
Session Objective
Imagine a tool that could instantly reveal the datasets, researchers, institutions, and focus areas behind the publications driving your research. How much time could you save, and how could this change the way you approach your research?
In today’s rapidly evolving research landscape, the ability to quickly and effectively find relevant data can be the difference between publishing in a top field journal or spending months finding the right publication home; securing funding for that highly competitive research grant or not; and spending hours instead of days searching for the right tool for your research project. The sheer volume of data available poses a significant challenge, but it also offers opportunities for those who can navigate this complex information ecosystem efficiently to develop technology advancements.
This session aims to explore these opportunities by conceptualizing an ideal tool for data discovery. Through this first activity, we will delve into how such a tool could transform your research workflows, enhance collaboration opportunities, and significantly improve research outcomes.
Getting Started
As we begin this thought experiment, consider yourself not just as a user, but as a key contributor whose insights could significantly influence the development of this dashboard.
Reflect on Your Current Process
Identify Your Needs
Reflect on the last time you were in search of data for your research. What were the key pieces of information you were trying to find? Consider aspects such as:
Statistics or specific data points
Limitations or scope of the datasets
Coverage or inclusiveness of the data


Understand Your Motivations
Why were you searching for this data? What questions were you asking yourself during this process?
Were you looking to see how others have used the dataset?
Were you curious about the publications or researchers associated with the dataset?


Envisioning the Ideal Tool
Time-Saving Features
Given your experience, list features that would have saved you time or enhanced your search for the ideal dataset. How would these features change your research process?

Broadening Your Research Network
Consider how a tool that identifies data experts and institutions involved in similar research areas could impact your work. Would this facilitate collaboration or offer new insights?

Access to Publications
How valuable would it be to have direct links to research articles using specific USDA datasets? Would this influence your choice of datasets?

Your Role in Shaping the Dashboard
Feedback and Suggestions
Based on your envisioned ideal tool, what suggestions do you have for the prototype USDA dashboard? Think about the search functionality, user interface, and any other aspects that would make the dashboard more useful for you and other researchers.

Discussion
Share your thoughts and suggestions with the class. What common features are most desired, and how do these align with the objectives of the USDA-funded dashboard?






Back to Top

articles.title: Data Discovery Tool Exploration: Role Play Scenarios
articles.contents:
USDA Data Usage Workshop
          
          
          Home
          Welcome & Start Here
          Breakout Room #1
          Breakout Room #2
          About
          Resources
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          Data Discovery Tool Exploration: Role Play Scenarios
          
            
                
                  
                    Publishing
                  
                
              
                            
                
                  
                    Writing Grants
                  
                
              
                            
                
                  
                    Finding Collaborators
                  
                
              
                          
        

        
          
      
      
        
          In this part of our workshop, we have designed a series of
          role-play exercises to simulate real-world scenarios you might
          encounter in your research. These scenarios will help us
          explore the utility and functionality of the prototype data
          discovery tool. Each scenario is crafted to highlight
          different aspects of the tool and how it can assist in various
          research activities such as publishing, grant writing, and
          collaboration.
          Through this exercise, we aim to understand the tool’s
          potential impact on your research workflows and
          decision-making processes. Please follow along as we navigate
          through each scenario, reflecting on the specific questions
          and tasks presented.
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Data Discovery Tool Exploration: Role Play

articles.title: Scenario: Using the Dashboard to Find Collaborators
articles.contents:
Purpose: You are looking to collaborate with other researchers who have used specific datasets in their work. How can the tool facilitate finding potential collaborators?
Tasks:
Locating Collaborators:
Use the tool to find other researchers who have used the datasets you are interested in. What is their background?

Exploring Publications:
Where have these potential collaborators published their work?

Reflective Questions
Consider the following questions:
What is missing from the tool or process?
What limitations or problems have we encountered?
What features of the tool did you find surprising or particularly useful?
Would you use this tool in your own research? Why or why not?
What additional functionalities would you like to see in this tool?

articles.title: Scenario: Using the Dashboard to Facilitate Grant Writing
articles.contents:
Purpose: You’re drafting a grant proposal and need exploratory analysis to motivate the research and explain its scientific novelty. How can the tool assist you in this scenario?
Tasks:
Comparing Datasets:
How can the tool help you compare datasets on this topic, including those that are not the most popular?

Exploring Data Sources:
How did you find the dataset?
What language/topics/terms did you input to find it?

Reflection Questions
Consider the following questions:
What is missing from the tool or process?
What limitations or problems have we encountered?
What features of the tool did you find surprising or particularly useful?
Would you use this tool in your own research? Why or why not?
What additional functionalities would you like to see in this tool?

articles.title: Scenario: Using the Dashboard to Support the Publication Process
articles.contents:
Purpose: Imagine you’re in the process of drafting a research paper and you need to identify relevant datasets for your analysis. The goal is to use the data discovery tool to find datasets that can provide novel insights into your research question.
Tasks:
Identify Datasets:
What datasets exist on your topic of interest? Use the tool to list the datasets you find.

Dataset Popularity:
Choose the most popular dataset according to the tool. Who is using this dataset, and what are their backgrounds?

Dataset Utilization:
How have others used this dataset?
Where have they published using these data?
What limitations do these data have?

Reflection Questions
Consider the following questions:
What is missing from the tool or process?
What limitations or problems have we encountered?
What features of the tool did you find surprising or particularly useful?
Would you use this tool in your own research? Why or why not?
What additional functionalities would you like to see in this tool?

articles.title: Resources
articles.contents:
Discovering Data Use and Value for Research and Policy
Special Issue
This workshop is particularly timely as the Harvard Data Science Review has recently published a special issue, “Democratizing Data: Discovering Data Use for Research and Policy,” presenting cutting-edge ideas on using robust AI tools to support evidence building in public policy and science.




Webinar
An accompanying Webinar (May 21-22, 2024) will feature authors of the papers, providing practical insights and a vision for how bottom-up collaborations and communities of practice can help shape the future of data democratization.

articles.title: Welcome to Democratizing Data
articles.contents:
Thank You for Joining Us!
We are delighted to have you participate in this workshop, aimed at exploring a prototype dashboard funded by the USDA. This tool, specifically designed to enhance the search-and-discovery process for USDA data assets, is in its developmental phase. Its developers are seeking feedback from prospective users to refine and improve the dashboard to better serve researchers in their search for datasets, identification of data experts, and discovery of publications using USDA data.
A Special Welcome from Julia Lane

Click the image above to watch a welcome video from Julia Lane, one of the creators of the Democratizing Data project.
Why Your Participation Matters
Research Value: Your engagement is central to the development process. As a research-oriented agricultural economist, your insights and feedback will directly influence the development of this platform, ensuring it aligns with the actual needs of the community. Your contributions today will inform the platform’s future enhancements, making it more intuitive and valuable for researchers like you.
Networking and Knowledge Sharing Value: This workshop is designed to be interactive and discussion-based, bringing together research-active agricultural economists. It represents a unique opportunity to connect, share knowledge, and learn from your peers—some of whom you may already know and others you are yet to meet. We hope these interactions foster a sense of community and collaboration.
Community Impact: The exclusivity of this workshop, limited to 40 agricultural economists, highlights the curated nature of this event. Your nomination to participate is a testament to the value we believe you bring to these discussions. Together, we have the potential to shape a tool that will serve not just our immediate needs but also set a benchmark for data discovery and application in policy oriented research.
Moving Forward
We value your perspective in shaping the development of a tool. We look forward to your active participation, insightful discussions, and feedback during this workshop.






Back to Top
